Description: Handle fragment from large pottery oenochoe, undecorated; flat handle, attached to small fragment of rim (slightly thickened offset collar rim) and small fragment of shoulder; clay gray, micaceous, with some lime inclusions, very hard-fired, surface blackish, burnished; East Greek grey ware.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 132, no. 373.1, pl. XL)
Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 238, no. 245)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GL.177)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4643 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
